titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Annie M. Holywell scrapbook 1978.060
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-17T15:42-0500

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Annie M. Holywell was the daughter of William C. (1822-1907) and Annie Lawrence (married December 4, 1856) of 615 Ocean Avenue in Brooklyn. She was at one time the head Kindergartener of the Meredith Free Kindergartens in Brooklyn, as well as a member and officer of the New York State Chapter of the Daughters of Founders and Patriots of America.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Annie M. Holywell scrapbook, 1978.060, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The Annie M. Holywell scrapbook spans the period 1902 to 1933 and includes clippings, photos, and postcards relating to Brooklyn, including obituaries of members of prominent Brooklyn families, and material relating to the Flatbush Dutch Reformed Church and Daughters of Founders and Patriots of America. It also includes poetry and some Holywell genealogy.
